<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COMMODITIES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/07/california-water-futures-first-trade-chicago-mercantile-exchange?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Back to the Futures
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of a red gumball vending machine filled with water in front of a light purple background. A small puddle has leaked out at its base. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzQ5L3dhdGVyX2Z1dHVyZXMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Looking for a liquid investment? As of yesterday, you can <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/07/investing/water-futures-trading/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">buy a futures contract</a> for 3.3 million gallons of water on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Quick detour to Finance 101</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, maybe 301. If you buy a commodity or security in a <strong style="color:#000">spot market</strong>, i.e., a physical or cash market, you purchase that thing for immediate delivery. California's spot water market is worth ~$1.1 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you buy a <strong style="color:#000">futures contract</strong>, you agree to purchase the asset at a predetermined price on a future date. Investors can buy futures contracts for commodities (like crude oil and wheat), foreign currency exchanges, precious metals, stocks, or bonds. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">California farmers could use the help</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">California is the country's largest water market by a magnitude of four, but its water supply is less consistent than a container of strawberries in January. The state is regularly hit by droughts, which can send affected farmers, utilities, and cities to the spot market—where prices are likely rising.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The new water futures, which are tied to a California water index, are supposed to help with <a href="https://www.nationalreview.com/2020/12/scarce-water-finally-receives-its-due-namely-a-price/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">risk management</a>. Investors hope that locking in prices will let buyers hedge (insure) against price fluctuations, especially during months when droughts and other factors strain supply. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why now?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Investors can buy futures contracts for everything from fresh bacon to <a href="https://twitter.com/anthony_j_zhang/status/1335348463878328321?s=09&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Burgundy wine</a>, but the commoditization of an element critical to daily life is worrying to some observers—especially as water access becomes more strained.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"Climate change, droughts, population growth, and pollution are likely to make water scarcity issues and pricing a hot topic for years to come," RBC Capital Markets Managing Director Deane Dray <a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2020/12/7/as-water-becomes-more-scarce-new-futures-trade-provides-buffer?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Bloomberg</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Over 2 billion people already live in countries with high water stress, a number the UN sees as only getting bigger.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>While these water futures are a first, climate change could spur more innovation around securing access to scarce resources. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/07/uber-sells-selfdriving-division-aurora-innovations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber Passes the Baton
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Uber announced <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/12/7/22158745/uber-selling-autonomous-vehicle-business-aurora-innovation?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the sale of</a> its Advanced Technologies Group (ATG) to Aurora Innovation. Don't let the drab name fool you: ATG was Uber's big bet on a fleet of self-driving vehicles. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why Uber is letting go: </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Self-driving cars are expensive</strong></span><span>. The division </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/11/16/uber-reportedly-talks-sell-atg-selfdriving-division?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">burned through</a></span><span> ~$500 million annually and was set to run out of cash next year.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The pandemic walloped ride hailing. </strong></span><span>Not that Uber posted a profitable quarter before Covid, but recent challenges have forced it to put some moonshot projects on the chopping block. Uber is reportedly unloading its </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/uber-sells-air-taxi-business-elevate-190158b9-9753-4f6d-a857-39f93af93222.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">air taxi division</a></span><span> too. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who is Aurora? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a young Silicon Valley startup working on self-driving semis and taxis that was founded by Chris Urmson, who LinkedIn cofounder Reid Hoffman called the "Henry Ford of autonomous vehicles." </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As part of the deal, Uber will invest $400 million in Aurora and CEO Dara Khosrowshahi will join the board. It’ll also eventually use Aurora's self-driving cars in its service. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Several self-driving startups have downsized or closed shop during the pandemic. Experts predict more consolidation ahead. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Want more autonomous vehicle news?</strong> Subscribe to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Emerging Tech Brew</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/07/bob-dylan-sells-songwriting-catalog-universal-music-publishing-group-historic-deal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
So, Bob, How <em>Does </em>It Feel?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bob Dylan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/12nXbkoWTPvM9W/giphy.gif">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, cultural icon/harmonica player Bob Dylan sold his entire catalog of more than 600+ songs to the Universal Music Publishing Group. The grand total? <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/07/arts/music/bob-dylan-universal-music.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">More than $300 million</a>, according to the New York Times (the actual terms weren't disclosed).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Dylan is one of the most famous artists of all time, and his catalog is considered a priceless treasure of the music canon. It's especially shiny from a biz perspective because of the royalties generated when other artists cover Dylan’s music—which they tend to do...often. His songs have been recorded more than 6,000 times.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A few more <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/shocked-face-with-exploding-head_1f92f.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Dylan stats before we move on: He's sold more than 125 million records globally and was the first songwriter to win the Nobel Prize for Literature.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Most impressively, he did it all without TikTok. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The times they are a-changin': </strong>With recorded music revenues back on the rise thanks to streaming, artist catalogs have become a <a href="https://variety.com/2019/music/news/music-producers-publishing-jeff-bhasker-deal-investment-banks-equity-1203307302/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hot investment target</a>. Fleetwood Mac singer Stevie Nicks just sold a majority stake in her own songwriting catalog, which was valued at around $100 million.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/07/china-trade-surplus-reaches-highest-level-ever?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
In November, Everything Was Made in China
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If international trade were a middle school lunch table, China just ended up with everyone's pudding cups. In November, China posted its <a href="https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3112820/china-trade-exports-sent-rocketing-coronavirus-lockdowns?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest month for exports</a> on record, and its trade surplus—the amount by which exports exceed imports—topped $75 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The massive trade surplus can be traced back to a familiar suspect: the pandemic. China's exports of medical equipment and WFH-related electronic goods have soared while two of its <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-exports-generate-record-trade-surplus-11607324070?mod=hp_lead_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">main trade partners</a>, the U.S. and EU, struggle to contain the virus. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Shipments to the U.S. specifically are up 46% from the same period last year, resulting in a $37.3 billion surplus. But analysts say that a vaccine could lead to a more balanced equation once the U.S. economy is firing on </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-global-trade-coronavirus-pandemic-china-united-states-76b934a5c6729de4466fc6ba89b4dcb2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all cylinders</a></span><span> again.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The U.S-China trade deficit is closely watched because one of President Trump's main economic goals was to reduce the imbalance by slapping tariffs on Chinese goods. President-elect Joe Biden said he wouldn't immediately unwind those tariffs when he gets to the White House.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/07/ikea-stop-making-iconic-catalog-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Ikea Says Farväl to Famous Catalog
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Hand reaching for Ikea catalogs " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzQ4L2lrZWFfY2F0YWxvZ3MuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jonathan Nackstrand/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Nicolas Sparks is proof that books can make you cry, turns out catalogs can bring on the waterworks, too. Yesterday, Ikea made the "emotional but rational" decision to discontinue its iconic furniture catalog after a 70-year run.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>A mainstay of coffee tables everywhere, the notoriously thick lookbook is said to be the most <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/ikea-catalog-finished-ended-online-store-swedish-furniture-2020-12?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">widely distributed publication</a> in the world—even more than the Bible. At its peak, Ikea produced 200 million copies in 32 different languages.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the Bible doesn't compete with e-commerce. Online sales (up <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/12/07/943886033/emotional-but-rational-ikea-discontinues-its-long-running-catalog?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">45% last year</a>) have become increasingly important to Ikea's business, and customers just weren't using the paper catalog as much as they used to. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Online furniture sales have been a pandemic winner for retailers like Wayfair and Amazon, so Ikea's decision to focus on its digital operations makes business sense. Just don't get rid of the meatballs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>If you're feeling nostalgic, visit the digital <a href="https://ikeamuseum.com/sv/ikea-kataloger/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ikea museum</a> to leaf through decades of past catalog issues.  </p>

\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ea\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003erelatively uneventful day. The Nasdaq \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/usa-stocks/nasdaq-hits-record-high-as-big-tech-leads-energy-stocks-battered-idUSKBN28H1A7?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit a record\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e thanks to a push from Big Tech, but energy stocks fell. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid-19 update: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. is now \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-07/u-s-covid-deaths-match-april-peak-with-hospitals-still-filling?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaveraging\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e about the same number of coronavirus-related deaths per day as during the first wave in April—around 2,200. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/international-news-health-germany-coronavirus-pandemic-198708d95297cd2020535f176bbba20a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe UK\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e will administer a Covid-19 vaccine today for the first time, though the first 800,000 doses will go to select groups. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! A small puddle has leaked out at its base. \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzQ5L3dhdGVyX2Z1dHVyZXMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLooking for a liquid investment? As of yesterday, you can \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/07/investing/water-futures-trading/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuy a futures contract\u003c/a\u003e for 3.3 million gallons of water on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eQuick detour to Finance 101\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, maybe 301. If you buy a commodity or security in a \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003espot market\u003c/strong\u003e, i.e., a physical or cash market, you purchase that thing for immediate delivery. California's spot water market is worth ~$1.1 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you buy a \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003efutures contract\u003c/strong\u003e, you agree to purchase the asset at a predetermined price on a future date. Investors can buy futures contracts for commodities (like crude oil and wheat), foreign currency exchanges, precious metals, stocks, or bonds. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCalifornia farmers could use the help\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCalifornia is the country's largest water market by a magnitude of four, but its water supply is less consistent than a container of strawberries in January. The state is regularly hit by droughts, which can send affected farmers, utilities, and cities to the spot market—where prices are likely rising.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe new water futures, which are tied to a California water index, are supposed to help with \u003ca href=\"https://www.nationalreview.com/2020/12/scarce-water-finally-receives-its-due-namely-a-price/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erisk management\u003c/a\u003e. Investors hope that locking in prices will let buyers hedge (insure) against price fluctuations, especially during months when droughts and other factors strain supply. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy now?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInvestors can buy futures contracts for everything from fresh bacon to \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/anthony_j_zhang/status/1335348463878328321?s=09\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBurgundy wine\u003c/a\u003e, but the commoditization of an element critical to daily life is worrying to some observers—especially as water access becomes more strained.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"Climate change, droughts, population growth, and pollution are likely to make water scarcity issues and pricing a hot topic for years to come,\" RBC Capital Markets Managing Director Deane Dray \u003ca href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2020/12/7/as-water-becomes-more-scarce-new-futures-trade-provides-buffer?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOver 2 billion people already live in countries with high water stress, a number the UN sees as only getting bigger.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile these water futures are a first, climate change could spur more innovation around securing access to scarce resources. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nUber Passes the Baton\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Uber announced \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/12/7/22158745/uber-selling-autonomous-vehicle-business-aurora-innovation?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe sale of\u003c/a\u003e its Advanced Technologies Group (ATG) to Aurora Innovation. Don't let the drab name fool you: ATG was Uber's big bet on a fleet of self-driving vehicles. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhy Uber is letting go: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSelf-driving cars are expensive\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. The division \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/11/16/uber-reportedly-talks-sell-atg-selfdriving-division?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eburned through\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e ~$500 million annually and was set to run out of cash next year.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe pandemic walloped ride hailing. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNot that Uber posted a profitable quarter before Covid, but recent challenges have forced it to put some moonshot projects on the chopping block. Uber is reportedly unloading its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/uber-sells-air-taxi-business-elevate-190158b9-9753-4f6d-a857-39f93af93222.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eair taxi division\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e too. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWho is Aurora? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s a young Silicon Valley startup working on self-driving semis and taxis that was founded by Chris Urmson, who LinkedIn cofounder Reid Hoffman called the \"Henry Ford of autonomous vehicles.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs part of the deal, Uber will invest $400 million in Aurora and CEO Dara Khosrowshahi will join the board. It’ll also eventually use Aurora's self-driving cars in its service. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eSeveral self-driving startups have downsized or closed shop during the pandemic. Experts predict more consolidation ahead. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Want more autonomous width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, cultural icon/harmonica player Bob Dylan sold his entire catalog of more than 600+ songs to the Universal Music Publishing Group. The grand total? \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/07/arts/music/bob-dylan-universal-music.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMore than $300 million\u003c/a\u003e, according to the New York Times (the actual terms weren't disclosed).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eDylan is one of the most famous artists of all time, and his catalog is considered a priceless treasure of the music canon. It's especially shiny from a biz perspective because of the royalties generated when other artists cover Dylan’s music—which they tend to do...often. His songs have been recorded more than 6,000 times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA few more \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/shocked-face-with-exploding-head_1f92f.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e Dylan stats before we move on: He's sold more than 125 million records globally and was the first songwriter to win the Nobel Prize for Literature.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMost impressively, he did it all without TikTok. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe times they are a-changin': \u003c/strong\u003eWith recorded music revenues back on the rise thanks to streaming, artist catalogs have become a \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2019/music/news/music-producers-publishing-jeff-bhasker-deal-investment-banks-equity-1203307302/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehot investment target\u003c/a\u003e. Fleetwood Mac singer Stevie Nicks just sold a majority stake in her own songwriting catalog, which was valued at around $100 million.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTRADE\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nIn November, Everything Was Made in China\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf international trade were a middle school lunch table, China just ended up with everyone's pudding cups. In November, China posted its \u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3112820/china-trade-exports-sent-rocketing-coronavirus-lockdowns?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest month for exports\u003c/a\u003e on record, and its trade surplus—the amount by which exports exceed imports—topped $75 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe massive trade surplus can be traced back to a familiar suspect: the pandemic. China's exports of medical equipment and WFH-related electronic goods have soared while two of its \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/china-exports-generate-record-trade-surplus-11607324070?mod=hp_lead_pos6\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emain trade partners\u003c/a\u003e, the U.S. and EU, struggle to contain the virus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eShipments to the U.S. specifically are up 46% from the same period last year, resulting in a $37.3 billion surplus. But analysts say that a vaccine could lead to a more balanced equation once the U.S. economy is firing on \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-global-trade-coronavirus-pandemic-china-united-states-76b934a5c6729de4466fc6ba89b4dcb2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eall cylinders\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e again.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe U.S-China trade deficit is closely watched because one of President Trump's main economic goals was to reduce the imbalance by slapping tariffs on Chinese goods. President-elect Joe Biden said he wouldn't immediately unwind those tariffs when he gets to the White House.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eJonathan Nackstrand/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile Nicolas Sparks is proof that books can make you cry, turns out catalogs can bring on the waterworks, too. Yesterday, Ikea made the \"emotional but rational\" decision to discontinue its iconic furniture catalog after a 70-year run.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eA mainstay of coffee tables everywhere, the notoriously thick lookbook is said to be the most \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ikea-catalog-finished-ended-online-store-swedish-furniture-2020-12?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewidely distributed publication\u003c/a\u003e in the world—even more than the Bible. At its peak, Ikea produced 200 million copies in 32 different languages.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the Bible doesn't compete with e-commerce. Online sales (up \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/12/07/943886033/emotional-but-rational-ikea-discontinues-its-long-running-catalog?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e45% last year\u003c/a\u003e) have become increasingly important to Ikea's business, and customers just weren't using the paper catalog as much as they used to. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Online furniture sales have been a pandemic winner for retailers like Wayfair and Amazon, so Ikea's decision to focus on its digital operations makes business sense. Just don't get rid of the meatballs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you're feeling nostalgic, visit the digital \u003ca href=\"https://ikeamuseum.com/sv/ikea-kataloger/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eIkea museum\u003c/a\u003e to leaf through decades of past catalog issues.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
